      47             : typedef uint32_t  nsCSSFrameType;
      48             : 
      49             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_UNKNOWN         0
      50             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_INLINE          1
      51             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_BLOCK           2  /* block-level in normal flow */
      52             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_FLOATING        3
      53             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_ABSOLUTE        4
      54             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_INTERNAL_TABLE  5  /* row group frame, row frame, cell frame, ... */
      55             : 
      56             : /**
      57             :  * Bit-flag that indicates whether the element is replaced. Applies to inline,
      58             :  * block-level, floating, and absolutely positioned elements
      59             :  */
      60             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED                0x08000
      61             : 
      62             : /**
      63             :  * Bit-flag that indicates that the element is replaced and contains a block
      64             :  * (eg some form controls).  Applies to inline, block-level, floating, and
      65             :  * absolutely positioned elements.  Mutually exclusive with
      66             :  * NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED.
      67             :  */
      68             : #define NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK 0x10000
      69             : 
      70             : /**
      71             :  * Helper macros for telling whether items are replaced
      72             :  */
      73             : #define NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED_NOBLOCK(_ft) \
      74             :   (NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED == ((_ft) & NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED))
      75             : 
      76             : #define NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED(_ft)            \
      77             :   (NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED_NOBLOCK(_ft) ||      \
      78             :    NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK(_ft))
      79             : 
      80             : #define NS_FRAME_REPLACED(_ft) \
      81             :   (NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED | (_ft))
      82             : 
      83             : #define NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK(_ft)         \
      84             :   (NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK ==         \
      85             :    ((_ft) & NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK))
      86             : 
      87             : #define NS_FRAME_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK(_ft) \
      88             :   (NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK | (_ft))

      91             :  * A macro to extract the type. Masks off the 'replaced' bit-flag

      93             : #define NS_FRAME_GET_TYPE(_ft)                           \

     223             : 
     224             :     // If set, the following two flags indicate that:
     225             :     // (1) this frame is absolutely-positioned (or fixed-positioned).
     226             :     // (2) this frame's static position depends on the CSS Box Alignment.
     227             :     // (3) we do need to compute the static position, because the frame's
     228             :     //     {Inline and/or Block} offsets actually depend on it.
     229             :     // When these bits are set, the offset values (IStart/IEnd, BStart/BEnd)
     230             :     // represent the "start" edge of the frame's CSS Box Alignment container
     231             :     // area, in that axis -- and these offsets need to be further-resolved
     232             :     // (with CSS Box Alignment) after we know the OOF frame's size.
     233             :     // NOTE: The "I" and "B" (for "Inline" and "Block") refer the axes of the
     234             :     // *containing block's writing-mode*, NOT mFrame's own writing-mode. This
     235             :     // is purely for convenience, since that's the writing-mode we're dealing
     236             :     // with when we set & react to these bits.
     237             :     bool mIOffsetsNeedCSSAlign : 1;
     238             :     bool mBOffsetsNeedCSSAlign : 1;
     239             :   };

     535             : private:
     536             :   // the available width in which to reflow the frame. The space
     537             :   // represents the amount of room for the frame's margin, border,
     538             :   // padding, and content area. The frame size you choose should fit
     539             :   // within the available width.
     540             :   nscoord              mAvailableWidth;
     541             : 
     542             :   // A value of NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE for the available height means
     543             :   // you can choose whatever size you want. In galley mode the
     544             :   // available height is always NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE, and only page
     545             :   // mode or multi-column layout involves a constrained height. The
     546             :   // element's the top border and padding, and content, must fit. If the
     547             :   // element is complete after reflow then its bottom border, padding
     548             :   // and margin (and similar for its complete ancestors) will need to
     549             :   // fit in this height.
     550             :   nscoord              mAvailableHeight;

     552             :   // The computed width specifies the frame's content area width, and it does
     553             :   // not apply to inline non-replaced elements
     554             :   //
     555             :   // For replaced inline frames, a value of NS_INTRINSICSIZE means you should
     556             :   // use your intrinsic width as the computed width
     557             :   //
     558             :   // For block-level frames, the computed width is based on the width of the
     559             :   // containing block, the margin/border/padding areas, and the min/max width.
